javadoc:
The ProgramDiffFilter is used when determining or working with differences between two programs. It indicates the types of program differences we are interested in. Each difference type can be set to true, indicating interest in differences of that type between two programs. False indicates no interest in this type of program difference.
Valid filter types are: BYTE_DIFFS, CODE_UNIT_DIFFS, PLATE_COMMENT_DIFFS, PRE_COMMENT_DIFFS, EOL_COMMENT_DIFFS, REPEATABLE_COMMENT_DIFFS, POST_COMMENT_DIFFS, REFERENCE_DIFFS, USER_DEFINED_DIFFS, BOOKMARK_DIFFS, SYMBOL_DIFFS, EQUATE_DIFFS, FUNCTION_DIFFS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT_DIFFS.
Predefined filter type combinations are: COMMENT_DIFFS and ALL_DIFFS.

methods.javadoc: Creates new ProgramDiffFilter with none of the diff types selected.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramDiffFilter with none of the diff types selected.

methods.javadoc:
Creates new ProgramDiffFilter equivalent to the specified ProgramDiffFilter.
@param filter the diff filter this one should equal.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramDiffFilter equivalent to the specified ProgramDiffFilter.

params.name: filter
params.comment: the diff filter this one should equal.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates new ProgramDiffFilter with the specified diff types selected.

params.name: type
params.comment:
one or more of the diff types "OR"ed together.
 i.e. CODE_UNIT_DIFFS | SYMBOL_DIFFS

methods.name: getFilter
methods.comment: getFilter determines whether or not the specified type of filter is set.

params.name: type
params.comment:
the set bits indicate the type of differences we want to 
 check as being set in the filter.
 For example, one or more of the diff types "OR"ed together.
 i.e. CODE_UNIT_DIFFS | SYMBOL_DIFFS

return.comment: true if filtering for the specified type of differences.

methods.javadoc:
set this filter to look for types of differences in addition to those
 types where it is already looking for differences.
 The filter that is passed as a parameter indicates the additional types
 of differences.
@param filter filter indicating the additional types of differences
 to look for between the programs.
methods.name: addToFilter
methods.comment:
set this filter to look for types of differences in addition to those
 types where it is already looking for differences.
 The filter that is passed as a parameter indicates the additional types
 of differences.

params.name: filter
params.comment:
filter indicating the additional types of differences
 to look for between the programs.

methods.javadoc:
setFilter specifies whether or not the indicated type of difference will be included by the filter (true) or not included (false). @param type the set bits indicate the type of differences we want to look for in the programs.
For example, one or more of the diff types "OR"ed together.
i.e. CODE_UNIT_DIFFS | SYMBOL_DIFFS @param filter true if you want to determine differences of the specified type.
methods.name: setFilter
methods.comment:
setFilter specifies whether or not the indicated type of difference will be
 included by the filter (true) or not included (false).

params.name: type
params.comment:
the set bits indicate the type of differences we want to 
 look for in the programs.
 For example, one or more of the diff types "OR"ed together.
 i.e. CODE_UNIT_DIFFS | SYMBOL_DIFFS

params.name: filter
params.comment: true if you want to determine differences of the specified type.

methods.javadoc:
Sets all the defined types of differences to false.
 Filter indicates no interest in any difference types.
methods.name: clearAll
methods.comment:
Sets all the defined types of differences to false.
 Filter indicates no interest in any difference types.

methods.javadoc:
Sets all the defined types of differences to true.
 Filter indicates interest in all difference types.
methods.name: selectAll
methods.comment:
Sets all the defined types of differences to true.
 Filter indicates interest in all difference types.

methods.name: getPrimaryTypes
methods.comment:
Gets all the valid individual types of differences for this filter.
 These are also referred to as primary difference types.

return.comment: an array containing all the currently defined difference types

methods.javadoc: typeToName() returns the name of the difference type. Only predefined types, as specified in ProgramDiffFilter, will return a name. Otherwise, an empty string is returned. @param type the type of difference whose name is wanted. @return the name of the predefined difference type. Otherwise, the empty string.
methods.name: typeToName
methods.comment:
typeToName() returns the name of the difference type.
  Only predefined types, as specified in ProgramDiffFilter,
  will return a name. Otherwise, an empty string is returned.

params.name: type
params.comment: the type of difference whose name is wanted.

return.comment: the name of the predefined difference type. Otherwise, the empty string.

methods.name: equals
methods.comment:
Determines whether or not this filter is equal to the object that
 is passed in.

params.name: obj
params.comment: the object to compare this one with.

return.comment: true if the filter matches this one.

methods.javadoc: Returns a string representation of the current settings for this filter.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a string representation of the current settings for this filter.

name: ProgramDiffFilter
comment:
The ProgramDiffFilter is used when determining or working with
 differences between two programs.
 It indicates the types of program differences we are interested in.
 Each difference type can be set to true, indicating interest in
 differences of that type between two programs. False indicates no interest
 in this type of program difference.
 Valid filter types are: 
 BYTE_DIFFS, CODE_UNIT_DIFFS, 
 PLATE_COMMENT_DIFFS, PRE_COMMENT_DIFFS, EOL_COMMENT_DIFFS, 
 REPEATABLE_COMMENT_DIFFS, POST_COMMENT_DIFFS,
 REFERENCE_DIFFS,
 USER_DEFINED_DIFFS, BOOKMARK_DIFFS,
 SYMBOL_DIFFS,
 EQUATE_DIFFS, FUNCTION_DIFFS, PROGRAM_CONTEXT_DIFFS.
 Predefined filter type combinations are:
 COMMENT_DIFFS and ALL_DIFFS.
